meanings.sent1: The town crier heralded the arrival of the king with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The news of the victory was heralded by the sound of trumpets.
meanings.sent3: The parrot heralded the start of the day by mimicking a rooster's crow.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers heralded the beginning of spring with their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The bright morning sun heralded a new day full of possibilities.

meanings.definition: To be a sign or indication of
meanings.sent1: Dark clouds heralded an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature heralded the onset of winter.
meanings.sent3: The loud meow of the cat heralded the arrival of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums heralded the start of the festival.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflake heralded the beginning of a snowy day.

meanings.sent1: The critics heralded the new movie as a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The fans heralded the singer's performance with loud cheers.
meanings.sent3: The dog heralded its owner's return by wagging its tail excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The award-winning chef was heralded for his culinary skills.
meanings.sent5: The students heralded their teacher's dedication with a surprise party.
